intro: Fosterella vasquezii, commonly known as the Vasquez's pineapple. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. This plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup to collect rainwater. The flowers are typically yellow or orange, and the plant produces edible berries similar to pineapples. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks in its natural habitat.
